item.title: Bain details ways to make money in the era of Generation #hashtag
item.description: Bain & Company, in their yearly report “Generation #hashtag ascendant: Think native digital first,” advises entertainment, media, publishing, and service industries to prioritize a “native-digital-first” approach. They define “Generation #hashtag” as individuals who favor content created and shared solely on digital platforms, especially mobile, regardless of their age. Bain notes that this group, first identified in 2014, now makes up almost half of all media consumers. Surprisingly, younger consumers are increasingly willing to pay for content even with limited budgets and access to pirated alternatives.

item.title: Letv reaches one million Facebook likes within two months
item.description: Source: Socialbakers. Letv, a company that has yet to formally debut in India, has already amassed a following of one million on Facebook in just 60 days. According to Socialbakers, Letv is currently the top and fastest-growing phone brand page in India. In contrast, it took Xiaomi India more than 400 days to achieve the same milestone*. Over the past month, Letv has consistently ranked high in Facebook popularity, rivaling established brands like HTC, Motorola, Lava, Vivo, and Xiaomi in India.

item.title: Huawei P9 and India Photo Project introduce Monochrome award in India
item.description: Source: Instagram. Top Instagram posts for the contest hashtag #ipp_ma2016 at the time of writing. Huawei, in partnership with the Instagram-based India Photo Project, has introduced the “Monochrome” award to commemorate World Photography Day on August 19th. This competition, running from August 20th to August 31st, aims to discover India’s top black and white Instagram photographer. The judging panel comprises Sumit Dayal, recognized as CNN’s Indian Instagrammer of the Year in 2015, Tara Bedi, the first Instagram employee from India, Devika Daulet Singh, Director of PHOTOINK, a prominent photography gallery, and Neeraj Priyadarshini, the Photo Editor at the Indian Express.

item.title: Bayara excels in creating engaging digital activities
item.description: Bayara, a Middle Eastern brand famous for dried fruits, nuts, and spices, hosted a unique iftar (Ramadan fast-breaking meal) at The Oberoi in Dubai. The buffet featured recipes submitted by their social media followers. Source: Bayara. Jean-Marc Lourau, CEO of Bayara, congratulated the winners whose dishes were featured at the buffet and also shared the progress that Bayara has made over the last 25 years that they have been in the market.

item.title: Twitter has revealed its inaugural collaboration with Singaporean musician @Sezairi
item.description: ● #SezairiQA and live songs on Twitter and Periscope @ 6:30pm on August 31, 2016 ● #SezairiLive debut show at Twitter APAC HQ in Singapore @ 7:30pm on September 2, 2016 ● Winners of @Sezairi photo caption contest get free tickets to #SezairiLive event Singaporean singer Sezairi (@Sezairi) will be performing live (#SezairiLive) on Twitter, Periscope, and at Twitter’s Asia Pacific headquarters. item.title: Tickets for the Nathan Hartono showcase are now available through Singtel
item.description: Source: Singtel. Nathan Hartono recently held a live performance on Singtel’s Facebook page. Nathan Hartono’s performance video, broadcasted on Singtel’s Facebook page last week, has garnered over 99,000 views and is still climbing. This event is a continuation of Singtel’s Christmas tradition of giving back to the community and supporting the Singtel Touching Lives Fund. During the event, organized by Singtel to celebrate the festive season and spread generosity, fans could interact with Hartono and request song dedications for their loved ones.

item.title: Alizz Islamic Bank celebrates reaching 100,000 Facebook Likes
item.description: Alizz Islamic Bank has achieved a significant milestone by reaching 100,000 likes on Facebook. This achievement places them among the top two banks in Oman to attain this level of popularity on the platform. Over the past year, Alizz Islamic Bank has significantly bolstered its social media presence, driven by a strong belief in its ability to enhance customer service. In addition to their Facebook success, they have also surpassed 30,000 followers on Instagram.

item.title: Singaporeans have the opportunity to apply for government grants to assist with their studies in infocomm, media, and design
item.description: Singaporeans working in Infocomm, Media, and Design can apply for the SkillsFuture Study Awards until June 14, 2016. Announced during the Ministry of Communications and Information’s Committee of Supply Debate for 2016, the SkillsFuture Study Award encourages Singaporeans to enhance their skills in sectors crucial for future economic growth. Minister for Communications and Information, Dr. Yaacob Ibrahim, stated that 310 awards will be granted to Singaporeans in the early or middle stages of their careers who are looking to advance their skills in these sectors.

item.title: Ericsson reveals insights on video consumption habits of consumers in Singapore
item.description: Looking for effective ways to invest your marketing budget? The recent Ericsson ConsumerLab TV & Media Report might offer some valuable insights. Now in its fifth year, the study surveyed 1,000 individuals in Singapore for the first time. The results reveal that 80% of Singaporeans engage in streaming TV or video content at least once a week, while 72% continue to watch traditional broadcast programs. Globally, 75% of consumers stream content multiple times weekly, compared to 77% who watch scheduled broadcast TV programs.

item.title: Instagram outperformed Facebook during the Rio 2016 Olympics
item.description: Source: ComScore. Social network interactions between Facebook and Instagram for July 2016 around the Olympic games, which ran from 5 to 21 August. ComScore, a media measurement company, found that Instagram was the top platform for engagement during the 2016 Rio Olympics, even though Facebook, its parent company, was primarily used for pre-event official content sharing.
